head.title: Treasury Offerings Set for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Offerings Set for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to the today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.99 percent and a six-month bill was 6.01 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to the today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.99 percent and a six-month bill was 6.01 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Comdisco Incorporated, $300-$400 million of debt securities. Baa1/BBB+/---. Salomon Smith Barney.

Visteon Corporation, $1.2 billion of 2-part global certificates ($500 million due in 2005, $700 million due in 2010). Baa2/BBB/---. Goldman, Sachs & Co., Morgan Stanley, Dean Witter & Co., Salomon Smith Barney, joint-leads. (Source: MCM CorporateWatch)
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
New Jersey Housing, $110 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Port of Seattle, $370 million of revenue bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Private College and University Authority, for Emery University, Atlanta, $130 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Incorporated.
Route 3 North Improvement Corporation, for the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, $300 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
St. Louis Airport, $85 million of revenue bonds. Salomon Smith Barney.
State of Michigan, $123 million of certificates of participation. Merrill Lynch & Co.
